name: Gamla Stan
description: Historic Old Town with cobblestone streets and colorful facades

name: Royal Palace
description: One of Europe’s largest palaces, official residence of the Swedish monarch

name: Stockholm City Hall
description: Iconic red-brick building, site of the Nobel banquet

name: Vasa Museum
description: Preserved 17th-century warship in a purpose-built gallery

name: Skansen Open-Air Museum
description: World’s oldest open-air museum showcasing Swedish life

name: ABBA: The Museum
description: Interactive exhibits celebrating the legendary pop group

name: Moderna Museet
description: Modern and contemporary art on Skeppsholmen island

name: Fotografiska
description: Global photography exhibitions in a repurposed customs house

name: Drottningholm Palace
description: UNESCO-listed royal residence and gardens

name: Gröna Lund
description: Historic amusement park on Djurgården with rides and concerts

name: Östermalms Saluhall
description: 19th-century food hall offering gourmet Swedish delicacies

name: Södermalm District
description: Trendy area with boutiques, bars, and street art

name: Monteliusvägen
description: Scenic walking path with panoramic city skyline vistas

name: Djurgården
description: Green island home to many museums and parks

name: Royal Canal Boat Tour
description: Guided cruise through historic waterways

name: Nobel Prize Museum
description: Stories of Nobel laureates and their achievements

name: Junibacken
description: Interactive children’s museum celebrating Pippi Longstocking

name: SkyView at Ericsson Globe
description: Glass gondola ride to the top of the world’s largest spherical building

name: Stockholm Metro Art Tour
description: Explore underground stations adorned with murals and sculptures

name: Haga Park
description: Royal park with Haga Palace and butterfly house

name: Vasaparken
description: Popular local green space with cafés and sports fields

name: Kungsträdgården
description: Central park famous for cherry blossoms and outdoor events

name: Guided Fika Tour
description: Taste Sweden’s coffee break tradition at top cafés

name: Swedish Cooking Class
description: Learn to prepare meatballs, gravlax, and cinnamon buns

name: ICEBAR by ICEHOTEL
description: Bar sculpted entirely from ice, kept at -5°C

name: Stockholm Archipelago Ferry
description: Island-hopping through thousands of Baltic isles

name: Riddarholmen Church
description: Medieval burial church of Swedish monarchs

name: Livrustkammaren (Royal Armoury)
description: Collection of royal costumes and armaments

name: Nordic Graphic Design Museum
description: Exhibitions of Scandinavian design and typography

name: Craft Brewery Tour
description: Sample local IPAs and stouts in Södermalm

name: Yasuragi Spa
description: Japanese-style onsen retreat just outside the city

name: Fjäderholmarna Island
description: Closest archipelago island with craft workshops

name: Traditional Boat-Building Demo
description: Hands-on introduction to wooden boat craft

name: Stockholm Ghost Walk
description: Spooky stories through the narrow alleys of Gamla Stan

name: Storkyrkan (Great Church)
description: Stockholm’s oldest church with stunning wood carvings

name: Hallwyl Museum
description: Lavish aristocratic town house preserved in time

name: Nobel Banquet Hall
description: Tour the grand hall where laureates dine

name: Stockholm Public Library
description: Cylindrical library designed by Gunnar Asplund

name: Djurgården Bike Tour
description: Cycle through museums and parkland

name: Millesgården
description: Sculpture garden and former home of Carl Milles

name: Hornstull Friday Market
description: Weekend street market with vintage finds

name: Södra Teatern Rooftop
description: Panoramic bar with live music in Södermalm
